warning_message: DANGER: Heating galvanized metal releases toxic zinc oxide fumes causing metal fume fever
safe_alternative: Use food-grade stainless steel, plain carbon steel, or cast iron for cooking surfaces

warning_message: DANGER: PVC can shatter explosively under pressure, sending deadly shrapnel
safe_alternative: Use copper, black iron, steel pipe, or rated rubber air hose for compressed air systems

warning_message: Direct aluminum-copper connections oxidize and overheat, causing house fires
safe_alternative: Use proper AL/CU rated connectors (like Alumiconn) or consult a licensed electrician

warning_message: Burning pressure-treated wood releases toxic chemicals including arsenic compounds
safe_alternative: Only burn untreated, natural, seasoned wood. Dispose of treated wood properly

warning_message: Cutting walls without checking for wires/pipes can cause electrocution or flooding
safe_alternative: Use a stud finder with wire detection, check both sides of wall before cutting

warning_message: Removing load-bearing walls without proper support causes structural collapse
safe_alternative: Always consult a structural engineer and get permits before removing any wall

warning_message: DANGER: Indoor generator use causes fatal carbon monoxide poisoning
safe_alternative: Always run generators outdoors, at least 20 feet from windows and doors

warning_message: Dry drilling tile creates heat cracks and silica dust (lung hazard)
safe_alternative: Use water cooling and diamond bits for tile, wear respiratory protection

warning_message: Welding galvanized metal releases toxic zinc fumes causing metal fume fever
safe_alternative: Remove galvanizing first, or use proper fume extraction and respiratory protection

warning_message: Improper ladder use is a leading cause of fall injuries and deaths
safe_alternative: Use ladder on firm level ground, maintain 3 points of contact, never use top step

warning_message: DANGER: Dryer/laundry duct is thin aluminum foil not rated for high heat - can melt, catch fire, or release toxic fumes
safe_alternative: Use only high-temp rated stainless steel duct or proper BBQ/smoker components rated for cooking temperatures

warning_message: DANGER: Thin aluminum ducting melts at BBQ temperatures (600Â°F+) and is a fire hazard
safe_alternative: Use proper high-temperature rated stainless steel ducting for any cooking/smoking application

warning_message: DANGER: Using materials not rated for food contact or high temperatures can release toxic fumes and cause fires
safe_alternative: Always use food-safe, high-temperature rated materials for cooking equipment
